The History of Eriol or Ælfwine and the End of the Tales

{{disambig-two|the mother of [[Ælfwine]]|[[Old English]] name of the wife of [[Eriol]]|[[Naimi#Etymology|Éadgifu]]}} {{anglosaxon infobox | name=Éadgifu | image= | caption= | people=[[wikipedia:Celtic Britons|Briton]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Lionesse]]
[[Kortirion#Other versions of the legendarium|Kortirion]] | affiliation= | language=''Presumably'' [[Old English]] | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse=[[Déor (father of Ælfwine)|Déor]] | children=[[Ælfwine]] | gender=Female | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Éadgifu''' was the mother of [[Ælfwine]], from whom he has heard stories of the "islands of the [[West]]",{{LT2|VIb}}, note 29, pp. 330-1 according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in the text called ''[[Ælfwine of England]]'' from ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. == History == Éadgifu was born in [[Lionesse]], a region of [[Luthany|Lúthien]], and was called as such by [[Déor (father of Ælfwine)|Déor]] her husband - even though that was not her original name. She had an unquenchable longing for the sea while she dwelt in the inland city of [[Kortirion#Other versions of the legendarium|Kortirion]]Kortirion was the [[Qenya|Elvish]] name of the town of [[wikipedia:Warwick|Warwick]].{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''30''', p. 310 with Déor, a trait which was inherited by her son Ælfwine. The [[Elves]] of Lionesse, with whom she was friendly with, sent messengers to his birth, presumably to give their congratulations. Éadgifu died during the siege of Kortirion by the [[Forodwaith (The Book of Lost Tales)|Forodwaith]] (i.e. [[wikipedia:Vikings|Vikings]]), and "her fair form lay unhonoured in [[Mindon Gwar]]".{{LT2|VIb}}, pp. 313-4 == Etymology == The name ''Éadgifu'' is in [[Old English]], being comprised of ''éad'' ("blessedness") + ''gifu'' ("gift").{{LT2|VIb}}, p. 323 == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | DEO |y| EAD |DEO=[[Déor (father of Ælfwine)|Déor]]|EAD='''ÉADGIFU'''}} {{familytree | | | |!| | | |}} {{familytree | | | ÆLF | | |ÆLF=[[Ælfwine]]}} {{familytree/end}} == Other versions of the legendarium == In an earlier text from ''The Book of Lost Tales'', ''Éadgifu'' was the Old English name for [[Naimi]], the Elven wife of [[Eriol]].{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''10''', p. 290 {{references|notes}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Eadgifu}} [[Category:Characters in The Book of Lost Tales]] [[Category:Men]] [[Category:Old English names]]
